THE CONSOLIDATED YOUTH PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO SUPPORT COMPREHENSIVE PROJECTS THAT FOCUS ON CHILD, YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT CENTERED PREVENTION, INTERVENTION, TREATMENT, AND RESPONSE STRATEGIES ON A CONTINUUM THAT MAXIMIZES COMMUNITY-BASED EFFORTS AND TRAUMA-INFORMED PRACTICES TO MORE FULLY ADDRESS SEXUAL ASSAULT, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, AND/OR STALKING.  THIS PROGRAM ALSO SUPPORTS ENGAGING MEN PROJECTS WHICH FUND MULTI-FACETED PREVENTION STRATEGIES THAT INVOLVE COMMUNITY ORGANIZING, OUTREACH, PUBLIC EDUCATION AND MOBILIZATION.  THESE EFFORTS ENGAGE MEN AS LEADERS TO DEVELOP, MAINTAIN OR ENHANCE PROGRAMS THAT WORK WITH MEN TO PREVENT SEXUAL ASSAULT, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, OR STALKING BY HELPING MEN SERVE AS ROLE MODELS AND SOCIAL INFLUENCERS OF OTHER MEN AND YOUTH AT THE INDIVIDUAL, SCHOOL OR COMMUNITY LEVEL.

THE KING COUNTY SEXUAL ASSAULT RESOURCE CENTER (KCSARC), LOCATED IN RENTON, WASHINGTON, IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT WORKS TO ALLEVIATE, AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE, THE TRAUMA OF SEXUAL ASSAULT FOR VICTIMS AND THEIR FAMILIES. KCSARC HAS BEEN PROVIDING SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND YOUTH SINCE 1989. 

THIS COMPREHENSIVE PROJECT WILL TARGET YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS UP TO AGE 24, INCLUSIVE OF YOUTH WHO IDENTIFY AS LBGTQ, WITH A FOCUS ON HOMELESS AND RUNAWAY YOUTH THAT HAVE BEEN VICTIMS OF, OR ARE AT RISK OF,  SEXUAL ASSAULT, TRAFFICKING, OR SEXUAL EXPLOITATION. 

WITH THIS AWARD, THE KING COUNTY SEXUAL ASSAULT RESOURCE CENTER WILL: 1) CONDUCT PREVENTION GROUPS THAT PROVIDE PREVENTION EDUCATION, BYSTANDER INTERVENTION TRAINING, AND PROMOTES HEALTHY RELATIONSHIPS FOR HOMELESS YOUTH; 2) HIRE AND TRAIN TWO YOUTH ADVISORS TO PROVIDE INPUT ON THE PREVENTION GROUPS; 3) IMPLEMENT A TRAIN-THE-TRAINER PROGRAM TO PROVIDE TRAINING TO STAFF FROM PARTNER AGENCIES TO SUPPORT PREVENTION EFFORTS OF THE PROJECT; 4) CONDUCT AN ASSESSMENT WITH RIVERVIEW SCHOOL DISTRICT TO IDENTIFY SCHOOLS FOR PREVENTION PROGRAMMING AND DELIVER OUTREACH AND PREVENTION PROGRAM TO STUDENTS; 5) CONTINUE TO CONVENE THE COMMUNITY RESPONSE TEAM TO ENHANCE AND IMPROVE SERVICES TO HOMELESS YOUTH; AND 6) CONTINUE PROVIDING ADVOCACY, CASE MANAGEMENT, AND TRAUMA-SPECIFIC THERAPY TO HOMELESS YOUTH WHO HAVE BEEN SEXUALLY ASSAULTED, TRAFFICKED, OR EXPLOITED.

THE TIMING FOR PERFORMANCE OF THIS AWARD IS 36 MONTHS.

CA/NCF

THE CONSOLIDATED YOUTH PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO SUPPORT COMPREHENSIVE PROJECTS THAT FOCUS ON CHILD, YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT CENTERED PREVENTION, INTERVENTION, TREATMENT, AND RESPONSE STRATEGIES ON A CONTINUUM THAT MAXIMIZES COMMUNITY-BASED EFFORTS AND TRAUMA-INFORMED PRACTICES TO MORE FULLY ADDRESS SEXUAL ASSAULT, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, AND/OR STALKING.  THIS PROGRAM ALSO SUPPORTS ENGAGING MEN PROJECTS WHICH FUND MULTI-FACETED PREVENTION STRATEGIES THAT INVOLVE COMMUNITY ORGANIZING, OUTREACH, PUBLIC EDUCATION AND MOBILIZATION.  THESE EFFORTS ENGAGE MEN AS LEADERS TO DEVELOP, MAINTAIN OR ENHANCE PROGRAMS THAT WORK WITH MEN TO PREVENT SEXUAL ASSAULT, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, OR STALKING BY HELPING MEN SERVE AS ROLE MODELS AND SOCIAL INFLUENCERS OF OTHER MEN AND YOUTH AT THE INDIVIDUAL, SCHOOL OR COMMUNITY LEVEL.

HOPE WORKS, INC., LOCATED IN BURLINGTON, VT, IS A NON-PROFIT RAPE CRISIS CENTER THAT PROVIDES VICTIM SERVICES, INCLUDING COUNSELING AND MENTAL HEALTH, TO ALL VICTIMS OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE, INCLUDING SEXUAL ASSAULT, SEX TRAFFICKING, CHILD SEXUAL ABUSE, AND STALKING. HOPE WORKS, INC. HAS A DEMONSTRATED HISTORY OF PROVIDING COMPREHENSIVE, SPECIFIC AND TARGETED SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND YOUTH VICTIMS OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE.  

THIS COMPREHENSIVE PROJECT WILL TARGET CHILDREN AGES 0  10, YOUTH AGES 11-18 AND YOUNG ADULTS AGES 19  24 WITH A FOCUS ON THE FOLLOWING YOUTH POPULATIONS: LGBTQ, HOMELESS, VICTIMS OF SEX TRAFFICKING, AND INCARCERATED VICTIMS. 

WITH THIS AWARD, HOPE WORKS, INC. WILL: 1) DEVELOP, EXPAND, AND ENHANCE VICTIM ADVOCACY SERVICES, INCLUDING MENTAL HEALTH, COUNSELING AND SYSTEMS ADVOCACY, TO THE AGE DEMOGRAPHIC AND TARGETED POPULATIONS FOR VICTIMS OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE, DATING AND DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, AND STALKING; 2) DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT PEER-TO-PEER SUPPORT GROUPS FOR VICTIMS WHO IDENTIFY AS LGBTQ; 3) DEVELOP AND DELIVER TRAINING FOR SCHOOL PERSONNEL, CHILD PROTECTION WORKERS, LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS, MEDICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH WORKERS, AND CHILD CARE WORKERS ON HOW TO APPROPRIATELY RESPOND TO CHILD AND YOUTH DISCLOSURES IN SCHOOLS, AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS, AND COMMUNITY-BASED PROGRAMS; 4) CREATE A COORDINATED COMMUNITY RESPONSE TO ENHANCE EARLY INTERVENTION, INCREASE MINOR VICTIMS ACCESS TO SERVICES AND SAFETY PLANNING; 5) PROVIDE SPECIALIZED SERVICES TO HOMELESS YOUTH, SEX TRAFFICKED MINORS AND YOUNG ADULTS, AND INCARCERATED YOUTH WHO ARE SURVIVORS OF SEXUAL EXPLOITATION AND SEX TRAFFICKING; 6) PROVIDE A SERIES OF EDUCATION/SUPPORT GROUPS TO SUPPORT LGBTQ YOUTH IN DEVELOPING SAFE AND HEALTHY RELATIONSHIPS AND POSITIVE SELF-AWARENESS; 7) UTILIZE THE SASS ACADEMY CURRICULUM AND CAMP OUTRIGHT PROGRAMMING TO CONDUCT PREVENTION EDUCATION IN TWO SCHOOL DISTRICTS AND ADAPT MATERIALS FOR LGBTQ STUDENTS; AND 8) EXPAND THE CURRENT BYSTANDER INTERVENTION EDUCATION, DATING VIOLENCE-FOCUSED PEER ADVOCACY PROGRAM, AND PEER-TO-PEER MENTORING THROUGH THE INTERCEPT PROGRAM TO THE BURLINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT AND MILTON SCHOOL DISTRICT TO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE OF DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL VIOLENCE AND STALKING AND ENHANCE STUDENTS' ABILITY TO RECOGNIZE HEALTHY RELATIONSHIPS FOR THEMSELVES AND THEIR PEERS. 

THE TIMING FOR PERFORMANCE OF THIS AWARD IS 36 MONTHS.

CA/NCF

VERA HOUSE CONSOLIDATED GRANT AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM TO ADDRESS CHILDREN AND YOUTH EXPERIENCING DOMESTIC AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE AND ENGAGE MEN AND BOYS AS ALLIES

THE CONSOLIDATED GRANT PROGRAM TO ADDRESS CHILDREN AND YOUTH EXPERIENCING DOMESTIC AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE AND ENGAGING MEN AND BOYS AS ALLIES (CONSOLIDATED YOUTH GRANT PROGRAM), A NEWLY ESTABLISHED DISCRETIONARY PROGRAM, WAS AUTHORIZED BY THE CONSOLIDATED AND FURTHER CONTINUING APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2012, PUB. L. NO. 112-55, 125 STAT. 552, 612-613.   THE CONSOLIDATED YOUTH GRANT PROGRAM COMBINES FOUR PREVIOUSLY APPROPRIATED OVW CHILDREN AND YOUTH FOCUSED PROGRAMS: THE GRANTS TO ASSIST CHILDREN AND YOUTH EXPOSED TO SEXUAL ASSAULT, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, AND STALKING PROGRAM (CEV); SERVICES TO ADVOCATE FOR AND RESPOND TO YOUTH PROGRAM (YOUTH SERVICES); SERVICES, TRAINING, EDUCATION AND POLICIES TO REDUCE SEXUAL ASSAULT, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, AND STALKING IN SECONDARY SCHOOLS GRANT PROGRAM (STEP); AND THE ENGAGING MEN AND BOYS IN PREVENTING SEXUAL ASSAULT, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, AND STALKING PROGRAM (ENGAGING MEN). 

THE CONSOLIDATED YOUTH GRANT PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO SUPPORT COMPREHENSIVE CHILD- AND YOUTH-CENTERED PREVENTION, INTERVENTION, TREATMENT, AND RESPONSE STRATEGIES ON A CONTINUUM THAT MAXIMIZES COMMUNITY-BASED EFFORTS AND TRAUMA-INFORMED PRACTICES TO MORE FULLY ADDRESS SEXUAL ASSAULT, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, AND/OR STALKING.  THESE STRATEGIES INCLUDE SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND YOUTH EXPOSED TO VIOLENCE, TRAINING FOR PROFESSIONALS TO IMPROVE INTERVENTIONS AND RESPONSES, COORDINATED SCHOOL-BASED STRATEGIES, SUPPORTIVE SERVICES FOR NON-ABUSING PARENTS, AND COORDINATED COMMUNITY RESPONSES. THIS PROJECT ALSO SUPPORTS INNOVATIVE PROJECTS THAT ENGAGE MEN AND BOYS TO ACT AS ALLIES WITH WOMEN AND GIRLS TO ADDRESS SEXUAL ASSAULT, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, AND/OR STALKING.

THE WICONI WAWOKIYA, INC, WILL IMPLEMENT THIS ENGAGING MEN AND BOYS PROJECT WHICH FOCUSES ON DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, DATING VIOLENCE AND STALKING.  THE PRIMARY TARGETED AGE GROUPS INCLUDE YOUTH AGES 12-17 YEARS OLD, WITH A SPECIAL FOCUS ON THE TRIBAL YOUTH POPULATION.  CA/NCF

ASSISTING CHILDREN AND YOUTH EXPOSED TO VIOLENCE AND ENGAGING MEN IN PREVENTION

THE GRANTS TO ENGAGE MEN AND BOYS AS ALLIES IN THE PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN AND GIRLS PROGRAM SUPPORTS PROJECTS THAT DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT STRATEGIES THAT ENGAGE AND MOBILIZE MEN AND BOYS AT THE INDIVIDUAL, GROUP, RELATIONAL, AND SOCIETAL LEVELS TO PREVENT DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, AND SEX TRAFFICKING.

 

THE GRANTEE AND PROJECT PARTNERS WILL IMPLEMENT A PROJECT ADDRESSING:  PURPOSE AREA 1: DEVELOP AND/OR IMPLEMENT PROGRAMMING TO RECRUIT AND TRAIN MEN AND BOYS TO SERVE AS ROLE MODELS, POSITIVE INFLUENCERS, CHANGE AGENTS, AND/OR MENTORS TO ADDRESS AND PREVENT DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, OR SEX TRAFFICKING. PURPOSE AREA 2: INTEGRATE EDUCATION ON DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, OR SEX TRAFFICKING INTO ESTABLISHED SUPPORT AND/OR ENRICHMENT PROGRAMS TO ASSIST MEN AND/OR BOYS IN DEVELOPING HEALTHY RELATIONSHIPS, CHALLENGING SOCIAL NORMS THAT SUPPORT VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN AND GIRLS, BECOMING ACTIVE BYSTANDERS, AND UNDERSTANDING THE INTERSECTION OF THESE CRIMES AND OTHER TYPES OF RELATED VIOLENCE. PURPOSE AREA 3: DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A TRAIN-THE-TRAINER PROGRAM FOR COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS OR PROGRAMS AND/OR GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES OR PROGRAMS TO INCORPORATE EDUCATION AND/OR TRAINING INTO THEIR EXISTING WORK WITH MALE CLIENTS TO PREVENT VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN AND GIRLS.  

THE PROJECT WILL: 1) ESTABLISH A COORDINATED COMMUNITY RESPONSE (CCR) TEAM TO OVERSEE AND GUIDE PROJECT ACTIVITIES; 2) COMPLETE A LIMITED COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND DEVELOP A STRATEGIC PLAN THAT OUTLINES THE IMPLEMENTATION PHASE OF THE PROJECT; 3) PROVIDE CRISIS INTERVENTION FOR CHILDREN, YOUTH, AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS AT ALL EDUCATIONAL, OUTREACH, AND TRAINING EVENTS NOT SPECIFICALLY TARGETED TO FIRST RESPONDERS OR ALLIED PROFESSIONALS; 4) CROSS-TRAIN PROJECT STAFF, PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS/PROGRAMS, AND CCR TEAM MEMBERS TO EXPAND THEIR KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND EACH OTHER’S ROLE(S) AS WELL AS IMPROVE THE PROJECT AND ACTIVITIES; AND 5) ENGAGE IN A PLANNING PHASE PRIOR TO PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION.

THE GRANTS TO ENGAGE MEN AND BOYS AS ALLIES IN THE PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN AND GIRLS PROGRAM SUPPORTS PROJECTS THAT DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT STRATEGIES THAT ENGAGE AND MOBILIZE MEN AND BOYS AT THE INDIVIDUAL, GROUP, RELATIONAL, AND SOCIETAL LEVELS TO PREVENT DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, AND SEX TRAFFICKING.

PURPOSE AREA 2: INTEGRATE EDUCATION ON DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, OR SEX TRAFFICKING INTO ESTABLISHED SUPPORT AND/OR ENRICHMENT PROGRAMS TO ASSIST MEN AND/OR BOYS IN DEVELOPING HEALTHY RELATIONSHIPS, CHALLENGING SOCIAL NORMS THAT SUPPORT VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN AND GIRLS, BECOMING ACTIVE BYSTANDERS, AND UNDERSTANDING THE INTERSECTION OF THESE CRIMES AND OTHER TYPES OF RELATED VIOLENCE.

THE GRANTEE AND PROJECT PARTNERS WILL IMPLEMENT A PROJECT ADDRESSING:  PURPOSE AREA 1: DEVELOP AND/OR IMPLEMENT PROGRAMMING TO RECRUIT AND TRAIN MEN AND BOYS TO SERVE AS ROLE MODELS, POSITIVE INFLUENCERS, CHANGE AGENTS, AND/OR MENTORS TO ADDRESS AND PREVENT DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, OR SEX TRAFFICKING. PURPOSE AREA 2: INTEGRATE EDUCATION ON DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, OR SEX TRAFFICKING INTO ESTABLISHED SUPPORT AND/OR ENRICHMENT PROGRAMS TO ASSIST MEN AND/OR BOYS IN DEVELOPING HEALTHY RELATIONSHIPS, CHALLENGING SOCIAL NORMS THAT SUPPORT VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN AND GIRLS, BECOMING ACTIVE BYSTANDERS, AND UNDERSTANDING THE INTERSECTION OF THESE CRIMES AND OTHER TYPES OF RELATED VIOLENCE. 

THE PROJECT WILL: 1) ESTABLISH A COORDINATED COMMUNITY RESPONSE (CCR) TEAM TO OVERSEE AND GUIDE PROJECT ACTIVITIES; 2) COMPLETE A LIMITED COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND DEVELOP A STRATEGIC PLAN THAT OUTLINES THE IMPLEMENTATION PHASE OF THE PROJECT; 3) PROVIDE CRISIS INTERVENTION FOR CHILDREN, YOUTH, AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS AT ALL EDUCATIONAL, OUTREACH, AND TRAINING EVENTS NOT SPECIFICALLY TARGETED TO FIRST RESPONDERS OR ALLIED PROFESSIONALS; 4) CROSS-TRAIN PROJECT STAFF, PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS/PROGRAMS, AND CCR TEAM MEMBERS TO EXPAND THEIR KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND EACH OTHER’S ROLE(S) AS WELL AS IMPROVE THE PROJECT AND ACTIVITIES; AND 5) ENGAGE IN A PLANNING PHASE PRIOR TO PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION.

THE GRANTS TO ENGAGE MEN AND BOYS AS ALLIES IN THE PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN AND GIRLS PROGRAM SUPPORTS PROJECTS THAT DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT STRATEGIES THAT ENGAGE AND MOBILIZE MEN AND BOYS AT THE INDIVIDUAL, GROUP, RELATIONAL, AND SOCIETAL LEVELS TO PREVENT DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, AND SEX TRAFFICKING.

 

THE GRANTEE AND PROJECT PARTNERS WILL IMPLEMENT A PROJECT ADDRESSING:  PURPOSE AREA 3: DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A TRAIN-THE-TRAINER PROGRAM FOR COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS OR PROGRAMS AND/OR GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES OR PROGRAMS TO INCORPORATE EDUCATION AND/OR TRAINING INTO THEIR EXISTING WORK WITH MALE CLIENTS TO PREVENT VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN AND GIRLS.

THE GRANTEE AND PROJECT PARTNERS WILL IMPLEMENT A PROJECT ADDRESSING:  PURPOSE AREA 1: DEVELOP AND/OR IMPLEMENT PROGRAMMING TO RECRUIT AND TRAIN MEN AND BOYS TO SERVE AS ROLE MODELS, POSITIVE INFLUENCERS, CHANGE AGENTS, AND/OR MENTORS TO ADDRESS AND PREVENT DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, OR SEX TRAFFICKING.

THE PROJECT WILL: 1) ESTABLISH A COORDINATED COMMUNITY RESPONSE (CCR) TEAM TO OVERSEE AND GUIDE PROJECT ACTIVITIES; 2) COMPLETE A LIMITED COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND DEVELOP A STRATEGIC PLAN THAT OUTLINES THE IMPLEMENTATION PHASE OF THE PROJECT; 3) PROVIDE CRISIS INTERVENTION FOR CHILDREN, YOUTH, AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS AT ALL EDUCATIONAL, OUTREACH, AND TRAINING EVENTS NOT SPECIFICALLY TARGETED TO FIRST RESPONDERS OR ALLIED PROFESSIONALS; 4) CROSS-TRAIN PROJECT STAFF, PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS/PROGRAMS, AND CCR TEAM MEMBERS TO EXPAND THEIR KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND EACH OTHER’S ROLE(S) AS WELL AS IMPROVE THE PROJECT AND ACTIVITIES; AND 5) ENGAGE IN A PLANNING PHASE PRIOR TO PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION.

THE GRANTS TO PREVENT AND RESPOND TO DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, AND SEX TRAFFICKING AGAINST CHILDREN AND YOUTH PROGRAM SUPPORTS COMPREHENSIVE, COMMUNITY-BASED PROJECTS THAT DEVELOP OR EXPAND PREVENTION, INTERVENTION, TREATMENT, AND RESPONSE STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF CHILDREN AND YOUTH IMPACTED BY DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, AND SEX TRAFFICKING, INCLUDING SUPPORT FOR THEIR NON-ABUSING PARENTS, CAREGIVERS, AND LEGAL GUARDIANS. 

THE GRANTEE AND PROJECT PARTNERS WILL IMPLEMENT A PROJECT ADDRESSING PURPOSE AREA 2 - CREATING SAFER COMMUNITIES FOR YOUTH: PREVENTION, INTERVENTION, TREATMENT, AND RESPONSE SERVICES FOR YOUTH IMPACTED BY DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, AND SEX TRAFFICKING.

THE PROJECT WILL: 1) ESTABLISH A COORDINATED COMMUNITY RESPONSE TEAM TO OVERSEE AND GUIDE PROJECT ACTIVITIES; 2) COMPLETE A LIMITED COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND DEVELOP A STRATEGIC PLAN THAT OUTLINES THE IMPLEMENTATION PHASE OF THE PROJECT; 3) PROVIDE DIRECT SERVICES THAT ADDRESS THE EMOTIONAL, COGNITIVE, AND PHYSICAL EFFECTS OF TRAUMA ON YOUTH VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, OR SEX TRAFFICKING; 4) DEVELOP AND DELIVER TRAINING TO LAW ENFORCEMENT AND OTHER ALLIED PROFESSIONALS TO APPROPRIATELY RESPOND TO AND SUPPORT YOUTH VICTIMS OF VIOLENCE; 5) DEVELOP AND DELIVER EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS THAT ADDRESS THE PREVENTION OF AND RESPONSE TO THE CRIMES PREVIOUSLY LISTED FOR YOUTH-SERVING ORGANIZATIONS AND PROGRAMS; AND 6) DEVELOP AND DELIVER PREVENTION PROGRAMMING FOR YOUTH THAT IS INCLUSIVE OF YOUTH-LED STRATEGIES, ASSISTS YOUTH IN UNDERSTANDING AND RECOGNIZING ABUSIVE BEHAVIOR, AND INCLUDES BYSTANDER INTERVENTION STRATEGIES.

THE GRANTEE AND PROJECT PARTNERS WILL IMPLEMENT A PROJECT ADDRESSING PURPOSE AREA 1 - SERVICES AND TRAINING TO ADDRESS CHILDREN EXPOSED TO DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, AND SEX TRAFFICKING.

THE PROJECT WILL: 1) ESTABLISH A COORDINATED COMMUNITY RESPONSE TEAM TO OVERSEE AND GUIDE PROJECT ACTIVITIES; 2) COMPLETE A LIMITED COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND DEVELOP A STRATEGIC PLAN THAT OUTLINES THE IMPLEMENTATION PHASE OF THE PROJECT; 3) PROVIDE DIRECT SERVICES THAT ADDRESS THE EMOTIONAL, COGNITIVE, AND PHYSICAL EFFECTS OF TRAUMA ON CHILDREN AND INCREASE THE SAFETY AND STABILITY OF CHILDREN EXPOSED TO VIOLENCE; 4) DEVELOP AND DELIVER EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS TO ASSIST FAMILIES IN CREATING VIOLENCE FREE HOMES FOR CHILDREN; 5) PROVIDE SUPPORT SERVICES FOR NON-ABUSING PARENTS, CAREGIVERS, OR LEGAL GUARDIANS; 6) DEVELOP AND DELIVER TRAINING TO LAW ENFORCEMENT, COURTS, PROSECUTORS, AND HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS TO APPROPRIATELY RESPOND TO AND SUPPORT CHILDREN EXPOSED TO VIOLENCE; 7) DEVELOP AND DELIVER TRAINING TO LAW ENFORCEMENT ON MAKING APPROPRIATE REFERRALS FOR CHILDREN EXPOSED TO VIOLENCE; 8) DEVELOP PROCESSES AND PROVIDE TRAINING FOR ORGANIZATIONS AND PROGRAMS SERVING CHILDREN TO IDENTIFY CHILDREN AND FAMILIES EXPERIENCING VIOLENCE AND MAKE APPROPRIATE REFERRALS FOR SERVICES; AND 9) DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT PREVENTION PROGRAMMING FOR CHILDREN.

THE GRANTEE AND PROJECT PARTNERS WILL IMPLEMENT A PROJECT ADDRESSING PURPOSE AREA 3 - PROVIDING SCHOOL-BASED SERVICES: PREVENTION, INTERVENTION, AND RESPONSE TO DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, AND SEX TRAFFICKING.

THE PROJECT WILL: 1) ESTABLISH A COORDINATED COMMUNITY RESPONSE TEAM TO OVERSEE AND GUIDE PROJECT ACTIVITIES; 2) COMPLETE A LIMITED COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND DEVELOP A STRATEGIC PLAN THAT OUTLINES THE IMPLEMENTATION PHASE OF THE PROJECT; 3) PROVIDE VICTIM SERVICES FOR STUDENTS, INCLUDING INCREASING ACCESS TO ON- OR OFF-SITE VICTIM ADVOCATES AND COUNSELORS; 4) DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT SCHOOL-BASED POLICIES, PRACTICES, AND PROGRAMS TO PREVENT AND RESPOND TO DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, AND SEX TRAFFICKING; 5) PROVIDE DEVELOPMENTALLY APPROPRIATE PREVENTION PROGRAMMING AND BYSTANDER INTERVENTION TRAINING FOR STUDENTS; 6) DEVELOP AND DELIVER TRAINING FOR SCHOOL RESOURCE OFFICERS, TEACHERS, SCHOOL FACULTY AND EMPLOYEES, AND COACHES ON CREATING TRAUMA INFORMED CLASSROOMS, SCHOOLS, AND PROGRAMMING FOR STUDENTS; 7) PROVIDING TRAINING TO ASSIST LAW ENFORCEMENT, PROSECUTORS, COURTS, AND SCHOOLS TO INVESTIGATE AND/OR PROSECUTE INCIDENTS OF THE CRIMES PREVIOUSLY LISTED WHEN THE STUDENT OR THE STUDENT’S CAREGIVER CHOOSES TO REPORT TO LAW ENFORCEMENT; 8) DEVELOP AND DELIVER TRAINING TO ASSIST SCHOOL FACULTY AND EMPLOYEES, LAW ENFORCEMENT, AND PARENTS, CAREGIVERS, OR LEGAL GUARDIANS IN SUPPORTING STUDENTS IMPACTED BY AFOREMENTIONED CRIMES; 9) IMPLEMENT PROGRAMS WITHIN THE SCHOOL AND/OR SCHOOL SYSTEM DESIGNED TO CHANGE ATTITUDES AND BEHAVIORS IN RELATION TO THE CRIMES PREVIOUSLY LISTED.

THE PROJECT WILL: 1) ESTABLISH A COORDINATED COMMUNITY RESPONSE TEAM TO OVERSEE AND GUIDE PROJECT ACTIVITIES; 2) COMPLETE A LIMITED COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND DEVELOP A STRATEGIC PLAN THAT OUTLINES THE IMPLEMENTATION PHASE OF THE PROJECT; 3) PROVIDE DIRECT SERVICES THAT ADDRESS THE EMOTIONAL, COGNITIVE, AND PHYSICAL EFFECTS OF TRAUMA ON YOUTH VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, OR SEX TRAFFICKING; 4) DEVELOP AND DELIVER TRAINING TO LAW ENFORCEMENT AND OTHER ALLIED PROFESSIONALS TO APPROPRIATELY RESPOND TO AND SUPPORT YOUTH VICTIMS OF VIOLENCE; 5) DEVELOP AND DELIVER EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS THAT ADDRESS THE PREVENTION OF AND RESPONSE TO THE CRIMES PREVIOUSLY LISTED FOR YOUTH-SERVING ORGANIZATIONS AND PROGRAMS; AND 6) DEVELOP AND DELIVER PREVENTION PROGRAMMING FOR YOUTH THAT IS INCLUSIVE OF YOUTH-LED STRATEGIES, ASSISTS YOUTH IN UNDERSTANDING AND RECOGNIZING ABUSIVE BEHAVIOR, AND INCLUDES BYSTANDER INTERVENTION STRATEGIES.

THE GRANTEE AND PROJECT PARTNERS WILL IMPLEMENT A PROJECT ADDRESSING PURPOSE AREA 3 - PROVIDING SCHOOL-BASED SERVICES: PREVENTION, INTERVENTION, AND RESPONSE TO DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, AND SEX TRAFFICKING.

THE PROJECT WILL: 1) ESTABLISH A COORDINATED COMMUNITY RESPONSE TEAM TO OVERSEE AND GUIDE PROJECT ACTIVITIES; 2) COMPLETE A LIMITED COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND DEVELOP A STRATEGIC PLAN THAT OUTLINES THE IMPLEMENTATION PHASE OF THE PROJECT; 3) PROVIDE VICTIM SERVICES FOR STUDENTS, INCLUDING INCREASING ACCESS TO ON- OR OFF-SITE VICTIM ADVOCATES AND COUNSELORS; 4) DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT SCHOOL-BASED POLICIES, PRACTICES, AND PROGRAMS TO PREVENT AND RESPOND TO DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, AND SEX TRAFFICKING; 5) PROVIDE DEVELOPMENTALLY APPROPRIATE PREVENTION PROGRAMMING AND BYSTANDER INTERVENTION TRAINING FOR STUDENTS; 6) DEVELOP AND DELIVER TRAINING FOR SCHOOL RESOURCE OFFICERS, TEACHERS, SCHOOL FACULTY AND EMPLOYEES, AND COACHES ON CREATING TRAUMA INFORMED CLASSROOMS, SCHOOLS, AND PROGRAMMING FOR STUDENTS; 7) PROVIDING TRAINING TO ASSIST LAW ENFORCEMENT, PROSECUTORS, COURTS, AND SCHOOLS TO INVESTIGATE AND/OR PROSECUTE INCIDENTS OF THE CRIMES PREVIOUSLY LISTED WHEN THE STUDENT OR THE STUDENT’S CAREGIVER CHOOSES TO REPORT TO LAW ENFORCEMENT; 8) DEVELOP AND DELIVER TRAINING TO ASSIST SCHOOL FACULTY AND EMPLOYEES, LAW ENFORCEMENT, AND PARENTS, CAREGIVERS, OR LEGAL GUARDIANS IN SUPPORTING STUDENTS IMPACTED BY AFOREMENTIONED CRIMES; 9) IMPLEMENT PROGRAMS WITHIN THE SCHOOL AND/OR SCHOOL SYSTEM DESIGNED TO CHANGE ATTITUDES AND BEHAVIORS IN RELATION TO THE CRIMES PREVIOUSLY LISTED.
